item.title: Erin add a quote by Fred Rogers
item.description: "Love isn't a state of perfect caring. It is an active noun like struggle. To love someone is to strive to accept that person exactly the way he or she is, right here and now." -- Fred Rogers

item.title: Erin add a quote by Fred Rogers
item.description: "Forgiveness is a strange thing. It can sometimes be easier to forgive our enemies than our friends. It can be hardest of all to forgive people we love. Like all of life's important coping skills, the ability to forgive and the capacity to let go of resentments most likely take root very early in our lives." -- Fred Rogers

item.title: Erin add a quote by Fred Rogers
item.description: "The greatest gift you ever give is your honest self." -- Fred Rogers

item.title: Erin add a quote by Martin Luther King Jr.
item.description: "Darkness cannot drive out darkness: only light can do that. Hate cannot drive out hate: only love can do that." -- Martin Luther King Jr.

item.title: Erin add a quote by Albert Camus
item.description: "Don't walk behind me; I may not lead. Don't walk in front of me; I may not follow. Just walk beside me and be my friend." -- Albert Camus

item.title: Erin add a quote by Criss Jami
item.description: "Just because something isn't a lie does not mean that it isn't deceptive. A liar knows that he is a liar, but one who speaks mere portions of truth in order to deceive is a craftsman of destruction." -- Criss Jami

item.title: Erin add a quote by Sean Covey
item.description: "Isn't it kind of silly to think that tearing someone else down builds you up?" -- Sean Covey

item.title: Erin add a quote by Honoré de Balzac
item.description: "It is always assumed by the empty-headed, who chatter about themselves for want of something better, that people who do not discuss their affairs openly must have something to hide." -- Honoré de Balzac

item.title: Erin add a quote by Criss Jami
item.description: "The only thing more frustrating than slanderers is those foolish enough to listen to them." -- Criss Jami
